Michelle Ingrid Williams
This article is about the actress. For the R&B singer, see
Michelle Williams (singer) .
ambox-notice" style=""
This article or section contains information about one or more Upcoming films|upcoming films. The content will change as more information becomes available closer to the release date(s).
Michelle Ingrid Williams (born September 9, 1980) is an
Academy Award -nominated
American
actress. Williams broke into stardom on the teen series
Dawson's Creek and later graduated to full-length features, most notably
Brokeback Mountain , for which she earned an Oscar nomination for
Best Supporting Actress
.
Biography
Early life
Williams, youngest of five children, was born in
Kalispell, Montana , the daughter of Carla, a homemaker, and
Larry Williams
, a well-known stock and commodities trader who is currently living in
Australia while fighting extradition to the
United States
on allegations of U.S. Federal Income Tax evasion which she disputes.1
Further information:
Larry Williams (trader)#Legal troubles
When Williams was nine, her family moved to
San Diego, California , and, at an early age, she became interested in acting. At age fifteen, faced with her parents' disapproval, she
emancipated herself from them. After completing the ninth grade at the Upper School of
Santa Fe Christian Schools
, in
Solana Beach, California , she left school in order to pursue her acting career in
Dawson's Creek .2
In 1997, at age sixteen, she won the Robbins World Cup Trading Championship, as her father had done ten years earlier.3 She turned $10,000 into $110,000 over the course of a year and that gain (as of 2006) is the fourth highest in the history of that competition (her father's being the highest).4
Career
Williams's career began in television, appearing in programs such as the 1990's version of Lassie,
Baywatch , Step by Step, and Home Improvement. Williams' first film role was in the motion picture Species. Soon after, she won additional roles, including the Jessica Lange-
Michelle Pfeiffer film
A Thousand Acres and the 1998 movie with
Joseph Gordon-Levitt and
Josh Hartnett . Williams's star profile rose considerably when in 1998, she was cast as one of the lead characters on the
WB show
Dawson's Creek . She would play
Jen Lindley for all six seasons of the successful show.
During and after Dawson's Creek's run, Williams made strong turns in several notable indie films. Her first starring role was as Arlene in the film
Dick , a satire of the
Watergate scandal
, opposite
Kirsten Dunst
. She starred opposite
Christina Ricci in
Prozac Nation , and also appeared in the HBO film
If These Walls Could Talk 2 , and several acclaimed indie pictures such as
The United States of Leland ,
Me Without You , and
Imaginary Heroes with
Sigourney Weaver . For her performance in
The Station Agent , Williams along with the rest of the cast received a
Screen Actors Guild award nomination for Best Acting Ensemble. In 2005, critics and audiences took note of Williams' performance in
Ang Lee 's
Brokeback Mountain . For her performance, she won a Critic's Choice Award and received
Golden Globe , BAFTA, and Academy Award nominations for Best Supporting Actress.
In 2006, she appeared in
The Hawk Is Dying , with
Paul Giamatti , and, in 2007, in both
The Hottest State , opposite
Ethan Hawke
, and
I'm Not There , directed by
Todd Haynes , with
Cate Blanchett
,
Richard Gere ,
Heath Ledger
, and
Julianne Moore
, among others.
She starred, along with
Ewan McGregor and
Hugh Jackman in the film
Deception , directed by Marcel Langenegger, which was released on April 25, 2008 in the
U.S.
The career of Michelle Williams was featured on the front page of The New Season: Film, part of the Arts & Leisure section of the
The New York Times , on September 7, 2008, in a 2-page article "For Michelle Williams, It's All Personal: Filmmakers Love Her Work, While the Public Remembers Her Heath Ledger Connection".5 As Lim observes, she has "repeatedly taken chances on under-the-radar indies", such as
The Station Agent and
The Hawk Is Dying , "while catching the attention of auteurs like
Wim Wenders
(" Land of Plenty"),
Todd Haynes ("
I'm Not There ") and
Martin Scorsese
(the forthcoming [''[[Ashecliffe]]''])" â€” formerly entitled the same as the novel it adapts,
Shutter Island , by
Dennis Lehane
â€” also starring
Leonardo DiCaprio and
Mark Ruffalo and opening in 2009.5 Along with Scorsese's forthcoming film, she shot four other films "in quick succession" since the summer of 2007: Wendy and Lucy, a film scheduled to open on December 10, 2008, and being shown on September 27 and 28 at the
New York Film Festival
; directed by the independent filmmaker Kelly Reichardt, Williams appears "in every scene as a young woman living hand to mouth on the road when her car breaks down and her dog goes missing in a blue-collar
Oregon
nowheresville"; as one of a "vivid ensemble cast orbiting around
Philip Seymour Hoffman
's harried theater director," in
Synecdoche, New York , the first film directed by
Charlie Kaufman , the screenwriter of
Adaptation. ; and two other films not yet distributed in the United States:
Mammoth , directed by "the
Swedish provocateur
Lukas Moodysson
," with Gael GarcÃ­a Bernal; and
Incendiary , which premiered at the
Sundance Film Festival
in 2008.5 In her interview with Lim, Williams said that she is "going to take a year off," as she "stopped feeling creative a little while ago, and ... [is] just realizing it now," and is also "feeling the strain of being a working single mom."5
Personal life
See main article:
Heath Ledger
Williams was engaged to
Australia n actor
Heath Ledger
and gave birth to their daughter, Matilda Rose Ledger, on October 28, 2005, in
New York City .6 Matilda's godfather is
Jake Gyllenhaal
78 while her godmother is
Busy Philipps , Williams' co-star on Dawson's Creek.9 The couple met on the set of the film Brokeback Mountain, in which they played husband and wife. During their time together, they lived in
Boerum Hill
, Brooklyn, New York.10 On September 2, 2007, People.com reported that, after three years together, Williams and Ledger had decided to separate.11 On September 4, 2007, Williams' father confirmed to Sydney Daily Telegraph that Ledger and Williams were no longer living together.12 In an interview given to Wonderland magazine, prior to Ledger's death, Michelle Williams spoke of their break-up and of her life as a single mother."1314
According to her interview with Lim for the New York Times, Williams "reads bedtime stories to Matilda ... in whatever accent she's practicing â€” East London for 'Incendiary,' Boston for ' Shutter Island' â€” but has had a hard time balancing the immersive demands of acting and the consuming duties of motherhood," and "The bleakness of some of the roles has also taken a toll."5 She "still finds herself reacting to the tabloid intrusions" of celebrity stardom "with bewilderment" and finds it difficult to "negotiate a gulf between private self and public image," and the phenomenon of celebritity " 'a bit of an isolating problem to have'."5 Lim also describes her as "an avid reader who favors poetry over novels while filming so she's not distracted by competing narratives" and who would like "to pick up a skill" like embroidery during her yearlong sabbatical from filming.5
Death of Heath Ledger
After Ledger was found dead in his New York apartment on January 22, 2008, from what was later determined to be an accidental overdose of prescription drugs,1516 an unidentified source reported to celebrity magazine
Us Weekly how Michelle Williams reacted, while in a hotel room in
Sweden
, where she was filming
Mammoth : "She cried and screamed as soon as she heard."17 On February 1, 2008, Ledger's publicist released her first public statement about his death: "Please respect our need to grieve privately. My heart is broken. I am the mother of the most tender-hearted, high-spirited, beautiful little girl who is the spitting image of her father. All that I can cling to is his presence inside her that reveals itself every day. His family and I watch Matilda as she whispers to trees, hugs animals, and takes steps two at a time and we know that he is with us still. She will be brought up with the best memories of him."18 In early February 2008, Williams flew from
New York City first to Los Angeles and then to
Perth , to attend
memorial and funeral services
,16 including a
wake
on
Cottesloe Beach .1920
